alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:48PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carbon and western Albany Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 248 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk Mountain, or 46 miles east of Rawlins, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Carbon and western Albany Counties. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 259 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
